author: kassandra.eth
content: Just as an example https://hackmd.io/@vbuterin/das?utm_source=preview-mode&utm_medium=rec seems very much in the rdirection of what I'm looking for resource-wise (if the topic was specifcally DAS on ethereum) but it's maybe a little too focused on details of the actual implementation and also doesn't provide any context for the rollup centric roadmap and why all of this is being done in the first place or why the particular cryptographic tools that were chosen are considered best for what's trying to be achieved. However the full mathematical clarity of the spec is super helpful here and hard to find elsewhere. So my conundrum is intro resources to this stuff either have the math and assumes you know the basic cryptocurrency prerequisites, or they give more intro to the cryptocurrency prerequisites but don't have enough of the "real" math/constructions. It's been hard to "put it all together" and I'm too noob to fill in the gaps of the different resources for this level of audience without saying some things that are probably way off-base/wrong.

author: kassandra.eth
content: TLDR: I am looking for "Intro to cryptocurrency _for cryptographers_" covering hopefully any or all of {economic security, scaling, rollups, privacy} etc
